author: 0xalizk
content: Do all nodes perform BLS aggregation and propagate aggregated attestations? Or do they just forward their own attestation (and other attestations they might receive) to a designated aggregator (=the proposer?) ?

author: benjaminion
content: The current design assigns a small number (16) of aggregators per committee who are supposed to aggregate the attestations they see on behalf of the whole committee. Attestations are  gossipped rather than forwarded to a specific validator aiui. https://github.com/ethereum/eth2.0-specs/blob/dev/specs/phase0/validator.md#attestation-aggregation

author: djrtwo
content:
There are two points worth noting here
1. Attestations see on the wire a valuable to those other than the expected next proposer (they add weight to your local fork choice)
2. A proposer might miss their block or not optimally include attestations, so it's valuable that proposers of subsequent slots also have the aggregates on hand
